Articles.Content:
Without going into gory details, this is the fourth space simulator/game I've played, and this one beats them all together, hands down.

For a mathematically challenged person like myself being able to go all the way to Mun on my first try (Well, since orbital training, anyway) is amazing!  The interface and training panels are wonderfully succinct and humorous.

Squad, you just collected another fan.
Welcome to the game and to the forum, @Rmack.
Thank you for the kind words, and welcome to the forums.

Hello Rmack and welcome to the forum!

Happy landings!

My favorite thing about KSP is that it strikes a perfect balance between those who don't like to overthink it and complicate things with math, and those who like to be precise down to the millimeter. When I first started the game, I was the former. I have quickly transitioned into the latter as I have began to grasp the underlying concepts that drive orbital mechanics. I wish I had found this game when I was like 12. I probably would have pursued a much different career path haha.
